alert.note: Alert for Eddy County Plains; Southern Lea County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 8:03PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Eddy and southwestern Lea Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 803 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Malaga, or 24 miles southeast of Carlsbad, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Eddy and southwestern Lea Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for western Texas.

area.areaDesc: Eddy County Plains; Southern Lea County
